abstract: A strike begun on Monday at one of Toyota’s parts suppliers in China prompted the auto giant to stop production at one of its 10 plants there.
snippet: A strike begun on Monday at one of Toyota’s parts suppliers in China prompted the auto giant to stop production at one of its 10 plants there.
lead_paragraph: TOKYO — Toyota Motor halted production at a car factory in China on Tuesday for the second time this month after workers at a supplier staged a walkout. It was the latest in a string of strikes that has hit Japanese carmakers just as they look to increase production in China, the world’s biggest auto market.

headline.main: With Strike, Toyota Idles Auto Plant in China
headline.print_headline: With Strike, Toyota Idles Auto Plant In China
